greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = A106291(n)/(modified A223486(n)), n >= 1.
comment: This sequence uses A223486 with the first two entries 1, 3, as obtained when one considers the Lucas numbers A000204 for n >= 1 (not A000032 for n >= 0).
results.author: _Wolfdieter Lang_, Jan 20 2015
